value.title: Architect API integration in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect API integration in Azure, and provide secure, scalable API access for your applications.

topItems.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Use API management to control who uses your APIs, to enforce usage policies, and to present a professional front-end to developers using the API.

images.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management

topItems.title: Improve the performance of an API by adding a caching policy in Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt:
API Management policies are configurable modules that you can add to APIs to change
their behaviors. Policies can do things like cache responses, transform documents and values,
call webhooks for notification or audit purposes, and retry requests after transient
failures. This module will use policies to enable caching in order to improve API performance
under load.

images.title: Improve the performance of an API by adding a caching policy in Azure API Management

topItems.title: Protect your APIs on Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Protect your back-end APIs from information exposure and implement throttling to prevent resource exhaustion with policies in Azure API Management.

images.title: Protect your APIs on Azure API Management

topItems.title: Control authentication for your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to protect your APIs from unauthorized use with API keys and client certificate authentication.

images.title: Control authentication for your APIs with Azure API Management

value.title: Build JavaScript applications with Node.js
value.excerpt: Node.js provides a large set of built-in APIs that help you build various types of applications, command-line apps, web apps, and more. It also offers testing and debugging capabilities and a rich ecosystem of third-party packages that you can easily add to your application.

topItems.title: Introduction to Node.js
topItems.excerpt: Learn everything about Node.js: what it is, how does it work and when to use it.

topItems.title: Create a new Node.js project and work with dependencies
topItems.excerpt: Create a Node.js project and learn to add packages and manage package dependencies in your project.

topItems.title: Interactively debug Node.js apps with the built-in and Visual Studio Code debuggers
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to efficiently debug your Node.js app using Visual Studio Code to fix your bugs quickly.

topItems.title: Work with files and directories in a Node.js app
topItems.excerpt: Build an app that manipulates files and directories with Node.js.

value.title: Data engineering with Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Learn how to harness the power of Apache Spark and powerful clusters running on the Azure Databricks platform to run large data engineering workloads in the cloud.

topItems.title: Describe Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Discover the capabilities of Azure Databricks and the Apache Spark notebook for processing huge files. Understand the Azure Databricks platform and identify the types of tasks well-suited for Apache Spark.

images.title: Describe Azure Databricks

topItems.title: Spark architecture fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: Understand the architecture of an Azure Databricks Spark Cluster and Spark Jobs.

images.title: Spark architecture fundamentals

topItems.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Work with large amounts of data from multiple sources in different raw formats. Azure Databricks supports day-to-day data-handling functions, such as reads, writes, and queries.

images.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks

topItems.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Your data processing in Azure Databricks is accomplished by defining DataFrames to read and process the Data. Learn how to perform data transformations in DataFrames and execute actions to display the transformed data.

images.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks

value.excerpt: Create a simple application and add configuration, client library references, and code to connect it to Azure Storage.

value.title: Store and share files in your application with Azure Files
value.excerpt: Azure Files provides a cloud-based file share for storing and sharing files to applications. Whether it's an application hosted in Azure App Service, an Azure VM, or an on-premises app, Azure Files can store and share file access between one or more applications and systems in a secure and failure-resilient manner.

images.title: Store and share files in your application with Azure Files

value.title: Use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Training a machine learning model is an iterative process that requires time and compute resources. Automated machine learning can help make it easier.

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) strategy
value.excerpt:
Learn how Site Reliability Engineering enables you to sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
topItems.excerpt: Organizations big and small have started to realize just how crucial system and application reliability is to their business. They’ve also learned just how difficult it is to maintain that reliability while iterating at the speed demanded by the marketplace. Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is a proven approach to this challenge.

images.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

topItems.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Respond to incidents and activities in your infrastructure through alerting capabilities in Azure Monitor.

images.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure

topItems.excerpt: Use application logs in Azure Web Apps to help debug web app code.

images.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage site reliability.

images.title: Manage site reliability

value.title: Threat Modeling Security Fundamentals
value.excerpt: This learning path takes you through the four main phases of threat modeling, explains the differences between each data-flow diagram element, walks you through the threat modeling framework, recommends different tools and gives you a step-by-step guide on creating proper data-flow diagrams.

topItems.title: Introduction to threat modeling
topItems.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective way to help secure your systems, applications, networks, and services. It's an engineering technique that identifies potential threats and recommendations to help reduce risk and meet security objectives earlier in the development lifecycle.

images.title: Introduction to threat modeling
Introduction to threat modeling

topItems.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
topItems.excerpt: Data-flow diagrams are graphical representations of your system and should specify each element, their interactions and helpful context.

images.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements

topItems.title: Provide Context with the Right Depth Layer
topItems.excerpt: Threat models can get complex if all parties involved cannot agree on a data-flow diagram depth layer that provides enough context to satisfy requirements

images.title: Provide Context with the Right Depth Layer

topItems.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
topItems.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective technique to help you identify threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk. We start by deciding to focus on either what needs to be protected or who it needs protection from.

images.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
Introduction to threat modeling

value.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
value.excerpt: You want to build great things on Azure, but you’re not sure exactly what that means. Using key principles throughout your architecture regardless of technology choice, can help you design, build, and continuously improve your architecture.

images.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework

value.title: Create a Linux virtual machine in Azure
value.excerpt: In this module, we discuss how to create a Linux virtual machine using the Azure portal.

images.title: Create a Linux virtual machine in Azure

value.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Create users in Azure Active Directory. Understand different types of groups. Create a group and add members. Manage business-to-business guest accounts.

images.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory

value.title: Principles of cloud computing and deployment
value.excerpt: Principles of cloud computing and deployment

value.title: AI business school for healthcare
value.excerpt: Decision-makers in healthcare have considerations that are particular to their industry to help them realize the true transformational impact of AI in the enterprise. This learning path is designed for healthcare industry decision-makers to illustrate the true transformational impact of AI in the enterprise.

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value
topItems.excerpt: AI has the capacity to empower the whole world to achieve more. From empowering technical development teams to mobilizing an entire organization to unlock the true potential of AI, enterprises need to think strategically about AI – and they need to start today.

images.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value

topItems.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in healthcare
topItems.excerpt: To realize the true transformational impact of AI in the healthcare sector, decision-makers must consider the special factors that apply only to their industry. To create real business value, a comprehensive understanding of all the strategic components is required.

images.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in healthcare

topItems.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture
topItems.excerpt: A successful AI strategy must consider cultural issues as well as business issues. Becoming an AI-ready organization requires a fundamental transformation in how you do things, how employees relate to each other, what skills they have, and what processes and principles guide your behaviors. This unit is designed to help you understand which are the key elements that make a culture AI-ready and proposes a framework to drive that change in your organization.

images.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance
topItems.excerpt: This module is designed for finance and affiliated business decision-makers to illustrate the impact of making strategic decisions with AI. The goal is to enable you to think about AI transformation holistically, with a focus on the cultural changes necessary to make AI transformation successful.

images.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance
Define an AI strategy to create business value

value.title: Azure for the Data Engineer learning path
value.excerpt: This learning path guides data engineers through the evolving benefits your organization gains with Azure cloud data platform technologies.

topItems.title: Understand the evolving world of data
topItems.excerpt: Learn how data systems are evolving and how the changes affect data professionals. Explore the differences between on-premises and cloud data solutions, and consider sample business cases that apply cloud technologies.

images.title: Understand the evolving world of data

topItems.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure technologies that analyze text and images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data. See how data engineers can choose the technologies that meet their business needs and scale to meet demand securely.

images.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform

topItems.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer. Find out how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI professionals. Explore common data engineering practices and a high-level architecting process for a data-engineering project.

images.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
Understand the evolving world of data

value.title: Azure for the Data Engineer
value.excerpt: Explore how the world of data has evolved and how the advent of cloud technologies is providing new opportunities for business to explore. You will learn the various data platform technologies that are available, and how a Data Engineer can take advantage of this technology to an organization benefit.

topItems.title: Understand the evolving world of data
topItems.excerpt: Learn how data systems are evolving and how the changes affect data professionals. Explore the differences between on-premises and cloud data solutions, and consider sample business cases that apply cloud technologies.

topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure technologies that analyze text and images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data. See how data engineers can choose the technologies that meet their business needs and scale to meet demand securely.

value.title: Develop IoT solutions with Azure IoT Central
value.excerpt: Interested in building end to end IoT solutions with Azure IoT Central, but aren't quite sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. The first unit creates the app, the second unit defines a device template for a refrigerated truck. Then, create a programming project, add code to simulate a truck, and communicate with your IoT Central app. The truck is monitored through a custom dashboard.

images.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app

topItems.title: Set up rules and take action on telemetry data in Azure IoT Central
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. We build the IoT Central app from a downloaded JSON file, defining all the device capabilities. Source code is also downloaded for the device app. The focus of this module is on creating rules and actions, to respond to certain telemetry input. Rules and actions enable greater automation of an IoT Central system.

images.title: Set up rules and take action on telemetry data in Azure IoT Central

topItems.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API
topItems.excerpt: The IoT Central REST API lets you manage applications programmatically. For example, you can add device templates, create devices, set device properties, send commands to devices, and manage data exports.

images.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API

topItems.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
topItems.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from the "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you control a refrigerated truck. This module adds continuous data export to both Blob storage, and an Event Hub. Then, a Power BI app is built to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

images.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
Create your first Azure IoT Central app
